name: multifocal
content:
multifocal adjective
(LENS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A multifocal lens (= a curved piece of glass or plastic) allows you to see things clearly at different distances away from them: multifocal contact lenses As they pass age 40, many people will need multi-focal lenses to help them focus on both near and far objects at work. Compare
bifocal
varifocal
More examplesFewer examplesDuring this procedure, the eye’s natural lens is removed and is replaced with a monofocal or multifocal artificial lens.New multi-focal IOLs enable patients to see at all distances, not just one.

multifocal adjective
(DISEASE)
medical
  specialized (of a disease) existing in more than one place in the body or part of the body : It was originally thought it was a multifocal cancer, each developing individually. Someone with multifocal breast cancer has more than one invasive tumour in one area of their breast.
More examplesFewer examplesDiffuse or multifocal damage affects many areas of the brain.Patients at greater risk of new tumourdevelopment are those with multifocal disease.
